name: Hotel Urban Brisbane

reviews.title: OK Accomodation
reviews.text: Overall accomodation in Australia is pretty expensive. I paid around $100 CDN a night for this hotel. It was the best rate I could get for a fairly decent centrally located hotel. Compared to other hotels that I have stayed in other cities I would rate the value of this hotel at around $60 per night. Although the hotel is in a good location the hotel rooms need to be updated and the hallways are dark and unattractive. There is also no deadbolt on your room door which as a solo female traveller made me nervous.

reviews.title: Real ales found!
reviews.text: For a three star this did not compare to the the same rated Golden Sands we stopped over in Dubai. It was similar to a travelodge and required refurbishment. It was however clean and satisfactory for our three night stay. Towels and bed linen were changed daily, with refreshments replenished. The lounge, bar and dining areas are of a much better standard than the rooms themselves. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The Hotel is situated at the top of a steep climb out of the Main shopping area and Roma st station. For real ale buffs, If you turn right out of the hotel and walk two streets away, pass St Andrews Hospital, you come to the International Hotel (Ex Cheers bar) which houses a microbrewery and serves four delicious real ales and great food!

reviews.title: Enyoyable
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights.Good quality comfotable rooms. Lovely balcony overlooking Roma Park. Close to town centre - but a steep hill to climb on return to hotel! Really pleasant restaurant with alfresco dining if preferred - but unimpressed with dinner menu so consequently ate out most evenings. However, good value breakfast & overall standard was good.

reviews.title: Rooms badly in need of makeover
reviews.text: We stayed here at the beginning of March 2007 only for 2 nights - the reception area downstairs is lovely and modern, but on taking the lift to our 2nd floor room , was disappointed to find a room badly in need of redecoration, Dirty walls and dirty tiles in the bathroom/shower., Shower power minimal - We had breakfast in the hotel which when eventually filled back up was fine.

reviews.title: Great basic accommodation
reviews.text: The swimming pool was very cold, even for my two boys who normally would stay in for a while, were out in two minutes.

reviews.title: Great Hotel..............in the 70's!
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in July this year.

reviews.title: Great location & excellant value
reviews.text: The hotel was reasonably priced for a 3 star and served the purpose well.

reviews.title: Great breakfast in reasonably priced hotel
reviews.text: The foyer and bar/restaurant area are very misleading, as our first impressions were the hotel was going to be quite trendy and modern. This we later found to be the case, however this comes in January 2008, when the hotel reopens as a 4 star "boutique" hotel. They are currently spending some $7m renovating the hotel, however the foyer and bar have been done first to lull you into a false sense.

reviews.title: Good Location, Nice Hotel
reviews.text: As for the rooms, these were quite dated, however clean and tidy and the towels changed daily. The decor was a throw back to the 1970's, but if you can see further than that, then the rooms were OK.

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay - Hotel Refurb Fantastic!!!!
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were exceptionally nice, and couldn't do enough for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through Wotif and got a great bargain with breakfast for 2 thrown in. The hotel is currently ungoing a major revamp. My husband and I stayed in a newly redecorated room and it had everything we needed... LCD television, mini bar, big bathroom, coffee and tea making facilities and an extremely comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Being revamped

reviews.text: The reception staff were friendly and helpful, secure parking was also included in our accommodation cost and breakfast on the top floor was self service but had a wide range of choices.
reviews.title: Good for an overnight stay

reviews.text: The location is great. Close to shopping and eateries.
reviews.title: Great View

reviews.text: Only grumble... we were on the second floor at the front of the building and heard quite a lot of noise from the street- boy racers and (small but annoying) the pedestrian signal beeping!
reviews.title: The old rooms are a disgrace

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Terraces on Wickham for an overnight stay between flights. The hotel was selected by my travel agent after I instructed her to book a hotel near the CBD. While not right in the CBD, this hotel is a short walk to the centre of Brisbane. The walk to town is largely downhill from the hotel.
reviews.title: The Worst Hotel Ever

reviews.text: My friend and I decided to book a 1 night mystery flight package as the weather had been great and we felt it would be nice to get away from home for a bit. On the departure date, the mystery was over and we found out we were headed to Brisbane and were booked at Terraces on Wickham. When we arrived in Brisbane, Coachtrans bus services picked us up along with a few other travellers waiting at the airport. Our first stop was the Novotel, which looked like a lovely place to stay. That’s why I was absolutely horrified when the bus finally stopped to let us off in font of an outdated, monstrously ugly white building which was apparently the hotel we were booked into.
reviews.title: Avoid this disgusting, drab hotel at all costs!

reviews.text: Upon entering the hotel, the lobby seemed reasonable as it had be decorated with modern furniture and fittings though the odour was reminiscent of a hospital ward. The desk staff however were friendly enough and check in was efficient.
reviews.title: good service, tired rooms but very comfortable
good for the price
reviews.text: The lifts were old and scratched inside with buttons chipped and missing. A cleaner’s closet and a dirty old mattress propped up against a wall were the first things which greeted us as the elevator doors opened. The hallway was faintly lit with awful fluorescent lighting which gave a very harsh and unwelcoming atmosphere.

description: Hotel Urban Brisbane. More than a hotel…Enjoy an accommodation experience with a difference. Hotel Urban Brisbane offers more than your typical hotel with more comfort, more indulgence and more inspiration. Situated close to Brisbane’s city centre, Hotel Urban Brisbane is an impressive, architecturally designed space, which features stunning views across the city skyline. A contemporary combination of modern comfort and designer chic, Hotel Urban Brisbane’s focus is on helping you kick-back and unwind in style. With ultra-comfy rooms and special perks, you’ll adore chilling-out in a striking space that will awaken your senses and leave you feeling rejuvenated.Whether you are staying with us for business or for leisure you’ll just love our rooms, designed with your comfort in mind. You’ll find numerous creature comforts including a cordless phone, comfy Slow Down Slippers, Tie Me Up Tightly Bathrobes and our fabulous Urban Snorer (the comfiest bed ever!). Plus, all our rooms have access to fresh air with their own private patio or walk-out balcony – perfect for appreciating the stunning Brisbane city skyline.Hotel Urban Brisbane will also tempt you with an awesome eatery. The Gazebo Bar & Restaurant experience is one for the foodies, offering a fusion of inner-city sophistication and innovative modern dishes. If staying in is your thing, try our lighter "In Room Dining" menu – sure to get the taste buds going!
